page.title: 07PARISH COUNCIL - GODSHILL
page.content:
Formed in 1895 its monthly meetings are open to the public who may not participate except in a 10 minute question time. Councillors are elected for 4 years, the next election being in 1987. There are 6 Parish Councillors and 1 Parish Clerk. Godshill Parish of 5760 acres has a population of 1064 people. The Council, at the grass root of local government, comments on local planning applications and is responsible for the maintenance of footpaths and the provision of bus shelters and litter bins. Godshill is one of the few Island Parish Councils operating its own cemetery which was opened in 1951 as the local churchyard was near capacity.
.
